newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil capital inflows reach $949.6 mln in January.
newsitem.headline: Brazil capital inflows reach $949.6 mln in January.

text.p: Figures from Brazil's Security Exchange Commission (CVM) showed that foreign investors pumped $949.6 million into Brazil last month, primarily into the stock market.
The money was invested under Annex Four rules which regulate foreign investment in Brazil's stock market, privatization bonds, securities and debentures.
Foreign capital inflows under Annex Four rules totalled $2.708 billion in January, with outflows at $1.758 billion, CVM reported.
Foreign capital inflows exceeded outflows by $15 billion last year in Brazil under Annex Four rules, CVM reported.
